item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 6:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Redis is open source again (552 points | 213 comments)
2. The Gang Has a Mid-Life Crisis (113 points | 41 comments)
3. Claude can now connect to your world (153 points | 58 comments)
4. We identified a North Korean hacker who tried to get a job at Kraken (259 points | 193 comments)
5. A faster way to copy SQLite databases between computers (309 points | 131 comments)

7. Dopamine signals when a fear can be forgotten (14 points | 6 comments)

9. Waypoint Transit (YC W25) Is Hiring a Founding Engineer ( | hide)
10. Fivetran to acquire Census (22 points | 9 comments)

13. Judge Rules Apple Executive Lied Under Oath, Makes Criminal Contempt Referral (529 points | 197 comments)

15. Office is too slow, so Microsoft is making it load at Windows startup (610 points | 771 comments)
16. AI code review: Should the author be the reviewer? (23 points | discuss)

20. 108B Pixel Scan of Johannes Vermeer's Girl with a Pearl Earring (426 points | 122 comments)

22. The Brief Origins of May Day (177 points | 179 comments)
23. The term "vegetative electron microscopy" keeps showing up in scientific papers (84 points | 22 comments)
24. Arizona laptop farmer pleads guilty for funneling $17M to Kim Jong Un (21 points | 12 comments)
25. Mercury: Commercial-scale diffusion language model (373 points | 161 comments)
26. Show HN: Hyperparam: OSS Tools for Exploring Datasets Locally in the Browser (34 points | 17 comments)
27. The one interview question that will protect you from North Korean fake workers (183 points | 144 comments)
28. Apple violated antitrust ruling, judge finds (1037 points | 491 comments)
29. 'ProtectEU' security strategy: a step further towards a digital dystopian future (16 points | 5 comments)
30. Pwning the Ladybird Browser (299 points | 50 comments)
